This is a Rmd for 12 month forecast for the tree methods. There are a total of 4 tree methods as listed below:
1) Single Decision Tree (tree and rpart packages)
2) Bagging Trees
3) Random Forests 
4) XGBoost 

From 3-4, for each method, we will form 2 models:
- model with tuned hyperparameters using recursive CV 
- off-the-shelf untuned model without consideration of time series data 

We will also create a benchmark of the AR(1) model for comparison. 
There will be a total of 8 models. 

```{r packages}
rm(list=ls())
source("results_function.R") # recursive CV, loss, directional accuracy functions 
```
```{r}
library(readr)
library(tree) 
library(rpart)
library(rpart.plot)
library(adabag)
library(randomForest)
library(ranger)
library(xgboost)
library(dplyr)
library(tidyverse)
library(ggplot2)

set.seed(1111)
```

```{r data}
train_12m <- read_csv("../12 Month/train_12m.csv") %>% as.data.frame() %>% # load data as df
  {rownames(.) <- .$date; .} %>% select(-date) # make date the rowname and remove the column 
test_12m <- read_csv("../12 Month/test_12m.csv") %>% as.data.frame() %>% 
  {rownames(.) <- .$date; .} %>% select(-date)

oilprices <- read_csv("../data/only_brent.csv") 
testdates <- read_csv("../12 Month/test_12m.csv") %>% as.data.frame() %>% select(date)
```

# Models 
## Model 1: AR(1) benchmark 
```{r}
fit_ar1_12m <- function(train_x, train_y, params) {
  training_set <- as.data.frame(train_x)
  training_set$y = train_y
  lm(y~r_1m_l0,data=training_set)
}

predict_ar1_12m <- function(model,test_x){
  predict(model, newdata = test_x)
}

ar1_rolling_results_12m <- perform_rolling_forecast(train_12m, test_12m, fit_ar1_12m, predict_ar1_12m, "y_lr_12m")
ar1_level_results_12m <- level_price_results(ar1_rolling_results_12m, oilprices, testdates)
mse_12m_ar1 <- MSE(ar1_level_results_12m$pred_level, ar1_level_results_12m$actual_level)
mse_12m_ar1
```

## Model 2: Decision Tree Untuned (tree)
```{r}
fit_tree_12m <- function(train_x, train_y, params) {
  training_set <- as.data.frame(train_x)
  training_set$y = train_y
  mindev <- ifelse(is.null(params$mindev), 0.0001, params$mindev)
  temp <- tree(y~.,data=training_set, mindev=mindev) # grow the tree
  prune.tree(temp,best=7) #prune back to 7 leaves
}

predict_tree_12m <- function(model,test_x){
  predict(model, newdata = test_x, type = "vector")
}

tree_rolling_results_12m <- perform_rolling_forecast(train_12m, test_12m, fit_tree_12m, predict_tree_12m, "y_lr_12m")
tree_level_results_12m <- level_price_results(tree_rolling_results_12m, oilprices, testdates)
mse_12m_tree <- MSE(tree_level_results_12m$pred_level, tree_level_results_12m$actual_level)
mse_12m_tree
```

## Model 3: Decision Tree Untuned(rpart)
```{r}
fit_rpart_12m <- function(train_x, train_y, params) {
  training_set <- as.data.frame(train_x)
  training_set$y = train_y
  fit <- rpart(y~.,data=training_set,method = "anova") 
  optimal_cp <- fit$cptable[which.min(fit$cptable[,"xerror"]), "CP"]
  prune(fit, cp = optimal_cp)
}

predict_rpart_12m <- function(model,test_x){
  predict(model, newdata = test_x, type = "vector")
}

rpart_rolling_results_12m <- perform_rolling_forecast(train_12m, test_12m, fit_rpart_12m, predict_rpart_12m, "y_lr_12m")
rpart_level_results_12m <- level_price_results(rpart_rolling_results_12m, oilprices, testdates)
mse_12m_rpart <- MSE(rpart_level_results_12m$pred_level, rpart_level_results_12m$actual_level)
mse_12m_rpart
```


## Model 4: Bagging Trees Untuned
```{r}
#fit bagging trees on default settings, ignore ts data
fit_bag_12m <- function(train_x, train_y, params) {
  training_set <- as.data.frame(train_x)
  training_set$y = train_y
  ranger(y~., data = training_set, num.tree = 500, mtry =945, importance = "permutation")
}

predict_bag_12m <- function(model,test_x){
  predict(model, data = test_x)$predictions
}

bag_rolling_results_12m <- perform_rolling_forecast(train_12m, test_12m, fit_bag_12m, predict_bag_12m, "y_lr_12m")
bag_level_results_12m <- level_price_results(bag_rolling_results_12m, oilprices, testdates)
mse_12m_bag <- MSE(bag_level_results_12m$pred_level, bag_level_results_12m$actual_level)
mse_12m_bag
```

## Model 6: Random Forest Tuned
```{r}
# P = 945, for regression mtry = P/3 = 315
fit_rfgrid <- function(train_x, train_y, params) {
  mtry <- ifelse(is.null(params$mtry), 315, params$mtry)
  training_set <- as.data.frame(train_x)
  training_set$y = train_y
  ranger(y~., data = training_set, num.trees = 500, mtry = mtry,importance = "permutation")
}

predict_rfgrid <- function(model,test_x){
  predict(model, data = test_x)$predictions
}

rf_component_grid <- list(
  mtry = c(30, 90, 150, 210, 315) # no of variables sampled in each split, 945 for bagging 
)

rfgrid_12m <- ts_cv_hyperparameter_tuning(
  train_data = train_12m,
  fit_fn = fit_rfgrid,
  predict_fn = predict_rfgrid,
  param_grid = rf_component_grid,
  n_folds = 5,                  
  cumulative = TRUE,
  model_name = "Random Forest 12m"
)
```

```{r}
# to select best hyperparameters for Random Forest
rfgrid_12m %>% arrange(mean_cv_mse) %>% head(5) 
# selected params: num.trees = 1000, mtry = 30
# noise error = 0.0087
```

## Model 7: XGBoost Untuned
```{r}
#fit the XGBoost model on default settings, ignore ts data

fit_xgb_12m <- function(train_x, train_y, params) {
  train_matrix <- as.matrix(train_x)
  xgboost(data = train_matrix, label = train_y, booster = "gbtree", nrounds = 500, objective = "reg:squarederror", 
    verbose = 0, nthread = parallel::detectCores() - 1, early_stopping_rounds = 10)
}

predict_xgb_12m <- function(model, test_x) {
  test_matrix <- as.matrix(test_x)
  predict(model, newdata = test_matrix)
}

xgb_rolling_results_12m <- perform_rolling_forecast(train_12m, test_12m, fit_xgb_12m, predict_xgb_12m, "y_lr_12m")
xgb_level_results_12m <- level_price_results(xgb_rolling_results_12m, oilprices, testdates)
mse_12m_xgb <- MSE(xgb_level_results_12m$pred_level, xgb_level_results_12m$actual_level)
mse_12m_xgb
```

## Model 8: XGBoost Tuned 
```{r}
# P = 945, for regression mtry = P/3 = 315
fit_xg <- function(train_x, train_y, params) {
  eta = ifelse(is.null(params$eta), 0.1, params$eta)
  train_matrix <- as.matrix(train_x)
  xgboost(data = train_matrix, label = train_y, booster = "gbtree", nrounds = 500, eta = eta, 
          objective = "reg:squarederror", verbose = 0, nthread = parallel::detectCores(), 
          early_stopping_rounds = 10, max_depth = 5, tree_method = "hist")
}

predict_xg <- function(model,val_x){
  val_matrix <- as.matrix(val_x)
  predict(model, newdata = val_matrix)
}

xg_component_grid <- list(
  eta = c(0.001, 0.025, 0.05, 0.1, 0.3)
)

xg_12m <- ts_cv_hyperparameter_tuning(
  train_data = train_12m,
  fit_fn = fit_xg,
  predict_fn = predict_xg,
  param_grid = xg_component_grid,
  n_folds = 5,                  
  cumulative = TRUE,
  model_name = "XGBoost 12m"
)
```

```{r}
fit_xg_tune <- function(train_x, train_y, params) {
  subsample = ifelse(is.null(params$subsample), 0.5, params$subsample)
  colsample_bytree = ifelse(is.null(params$colsample_bytree), 0.5, params$colsample_bytree)
  train_matrix <- as.matrix(train_x)
  xgboost(data = train_matrix, label = train_y, booster = "gbtree", objective = "reg:squarederror", eta = 0.3, 
          nrounds = 500, subsample=subsample, colsample_bytree=colsample_bytree, 
          verbose = 0,nthread = parallel::detectCores(), 
          early_stopping_rounds = 10, max_depth = 5, tree_method = "hist")
}

xg_component_grid_tune <- list(
  subsample = c(0.5, 0.8),
  colsample_bytree = c(0.5, 0.8)
)

xg_12m_tuned <- ts_cv_hyperparameter_tuning(
  train_data = train_12m,
  fit_fn = fit_xg_tune,
  predict_fn = predict_xg,
  param_grid = xg_component_grid_tune,
  n_folds = 5,                  
  cumulative = TRUE,
  model_name = "XGBoost 12m tuned"
)
```

```{r}
# to select best hyperparameters for XGBoost
xg_12m_tuned %>% arrange(mean_cv_mse) %>% head(5) 
# selected params: nrounds = 500, gamma = 5, max_depth = 7, subsample = 0.5, colsample_bytree = 0.9
# noise error = 0.0087
```

```{r}
fit_xgbtune_12m <- function(train_x, train_y, params) {
  train_matrix <- as.matrix(train_x)
  xgboost(data = train_matrix, label = train_y, booster = "gbtree", nrounds = 500, max_depth = 7, subsample = 0.8,
            colsample_bytree = 0.7, eta = 0.3, verbose = 0, objective = "reg:squarederror", 
            nthread = parallel::detectCores(), early_stopping_rounds = 10,tree_method = "hist")
}

xgbtune_rolling_results_12m <- perform_rolling_forecast(train_12m, test_12m, fit_xgbtune_12m, predict_xgb_12m, "y_lr_12m")
xgbtune_level_results_12m <- level_price_results(xgbtune_rolling_results_12m, oilprices, testdates)
```
